summary: The Secure Family Futures Act of 2025 amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to address how debt is treated for certain insurance companies. Specifically, it excludes certain debt instruments held by applicable insurance companies from being considered capital assets. It also extends the capital loss carryover period for losses incurred by applicable insurance companies from 5 to 10 years.  These changes take effect after December 31, 2025 and aim to provide tax relief for these specific companies.
